sourcing.instructions: Ag (Silver): Local metal suppliers or online precious metal retailers. Co (Cobalt): Chemical supply stores or online chemical distributors. Er (Erbium): Specialty metal suppliers or online rare earth metal retailers. Mg (Magnesium): Local hardware stores or online metal suppliers. Tb (Terbium): Rare earth metal suppliers or online retailers.
steps: Ag (Silver): Local metal suppliers or online precious metal retailers. Co (Cobalt): Chemical supply stores or online chemical distributors. Er (Erbium): Specialty metal suppliers or online rare earth metal retailers. Mg (Magnesium): Local hardware stores or online metal suppliers. Tb (Terbium): Rare earth metal suppliers or online retailers.

1. Measure out each material using an electronic scale for precision. 2. Place Ag, Co, Er, Mg, and Tb into a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a ceramic or glass stir rod to mix the powders thoroughly to ensure even distribution. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a mortar and grind gently to achieve a fine, homogeneous mixture.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out each material using an electronic scale for precision. 2. Place Ag, Co, Er, Mg, and Tb into a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a ceramic or glass stir rod to mix the powders thoroughly to ensure even distribution. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a mortar and grind gently to achieve a fine, homogeneous mixture.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace or high-temperature oven to 800 °C (1472 °F). 2. Place the mixed powders in a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Insert the crucible into the preheated furnace.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace or high-temperature oven to 800 °C (1472 °F). 2. Place the mixed powders in a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Insert the crucible into the preheated furnace.

steps: 1. After heating for 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 20-25 °C). 2. Do not remove the crucible until the furnace is completely cool to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After heating for 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 20-25 °C). 2. Do not remove the crucible until the furnace is completely cool to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use sandpaper (grit 120 to 400) to smooth the surfaces of the solid sample. 3. Optionally, seal with a clear epoxy or lacquer for enhanced durability. 4. Allow the sealing agent to cure for the recommended time according to the product instructions.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use sandpaper (grit 120 to 400) to smooth the surfaces of the solid sample. 3. Optionally, seal with a clear epoxy or lacquer for enhanced durability. 4. Allow the sealing agent to cure for the recommended time according to the product instructions.
